security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-based documentation skill with no executable code. The skill provides guidelines for using markdownlint-cli2, a legitimate open-source markdown linting tool. No concerning patterns detected.

content.user_title: Lint and fix markdown formatting issues
content.value_statement: Markdown files often have style issues that reduce readability and consistency. This skill uses markdownlint-cli2 to automatically detect and fix common markdown problems, ensuring documents follow best practices.
actual_capabilities: Check markdown files for style issues using markdownlint-cli2
Automatically fix 70-90% of markdown formatting problems
Validate markdown documents against configurable rules
Apply consistent markdown styling across documents
Identify issues requiring manual judgment and fix them
limitations: Requires markdownlint-cli2 to be installed on the system
Some issues like document hierarchy require manual judgment
Line length rules may need configuration for specific use cases
Cannot fix intentional rule violations in code examples

use_cases.title: Standardize documentation
use_cases.description: Ensure all documentation files follow consistent markdown style and formatting rules across a project.

use_cases.title: Validate README files
use_cases.description: Check and fix markdown formatting in README files, contribution guides, and project documentation.

use_cases.title: Improve content readability
use_cases.description: Clean up markdown formatting in blog posts, articles, and educational content for better readability.

prompt_templates.title: Basic lint check
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the markdown skill to check this markdown file for style issues and fix any problems found.

prompt_templates.title: Auto-fix mode
prompt_templates.prompt: Run markdownlint-cli2 with --fix to automatically correct formatting issues in this document.

prompt_templates.title: With custom config
prompt_templates.prompt: Lint this markdown file with a custom configuration that disables line length checking (MD013).

prompt_templates.title: Full workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply the full markdown lint workflow: auto-fix, check remaining errors, manually fix issues that require judgment, and verify with 0 errors.

output_examples.input: Run markdown lint on document.md and fix all issues
output: - MD025: Converted 2 H1 headers to H2
- MD036: Replaced bold emphasis with proper header
- MD013: Wrapped long line at natural break point
Final: 0 errors - document is now lint-compliant

best_practices: Run markdownlint-cli2 --fix first to handle automatic corrections before manual review
Create a .markdownlint.json config file to customize rules for your project conventions
Verify fixes with a final lint check showing 0 errors before considering complete
anti_patterns: Skipping auto-fix and manually fixing all issues (70-90% can be fixed automatically)
Ignoring errors without understanding what rule is being violated
Applying fixes without verifying the final document passes all lint checks

faq.question: Which markdown lint rules does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill supports all markdownlint rules including MD001 (header increment), MD004 (list markers), MD009 (trailing spaces), MD013 (line length), MD025 (single H1), MD036 (no emphasis as header), and many more.

faq.question: Can I customize the lint rules for my project?
faq.answer: Yes. Create a .markdownlint.json or .markdownlint-cli2.jsonc file to enable, disable, or configure specific rules like line length thresholds or code block exceptions.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my original files?
faq.answer: The auto-fix feature modifies files in place. Always work on copies or use version control. The skill shows commands to copy fixed files to output directories.

faq.question: What data does this skill access?
faq.answer: This skill only accesses markdown files you specify. No sensitive data, credentials, or system files are accessed. All processing is local using the markdownlint-cli2 tool.

faq.question: Why do some errors remain after auto-fix?
faq.answer: Auto-fix resolves mechanical issues like trailing spaces and list markers. Issues requiring judgment (document hierarchy, where to break lines) need manual correction using str_replace.

faq.question: How does this compare to other markdown tools?
faq.answer: This skill uses markdownlint-cli2 which follows the Markdown linting rules specification. It is more comprehensive than basic formatters and provides detailed error codes for each issue found.
